I do not have access to the latest data on the effectiveness of the measures taken to address the environmental impacts of mining in south america. however, it can be noted that there have been some notable successes and challenges in implementing sustainable mining practices in the region. 

on the positive side, some companies have implemented sustainable and responsible mining practices in south america, such as reforestation, water treatment facilities, and the use of renewable energy sources. in addition, some governments have implemented environmental regulations and policies to promote sustainable mining practices.

on the other hand, challenges remain in ensuring that sustainable and responsible mining practices are implemented across the region. one challenge is the lack of capacity among local governments to enforce environmental regulations and standards. corruption and weak institutions also pose challenges, as mining companies may have undue influence on policy and regulations, allowing them to continue with unsustainable practices.

furthermore, social conflicts and environmental disputes related to mining activities remain common in south america, often involving local communities and indigenous groups who are adversely affected by mining activities. it remains important to continue to work towards addressing these issues and promoting sustainable mining practices in the region.
